name: Chimera_finder
tagline: BASH scripts to extract chimeric pairs and chimeric reads from NGS data mixing 2 DNA references
body:
# Welcome to Chimera_finder Page

## Motivations
Chimera_finder consist of 2 simple Bash pipelines for illumina NGS data, originally dedicated to retrieval of viral insertion sites retrieval in an host cell genome (chimeric paired end and chimeric reads). 

## Principle
### chimera_finder_pair.sh
Description of the principle
### chimera_finder_single.sh
Description of the principle

## Get Chimera_finder
### From git hub repository 
``` bash
$ git clone repo_name my_folder/
$ cd my_folder/
```
### Direct download
https://github.com/a-slide/Chimera_Finder/archive/master.zip

##Â Usage
``` bash
$ sudo chmod u+x chimera_finder_pair.sh chimera_finder_single.sh
$ # For chimeric pairs extraction
$ ./Chimera
$ # For chimeric splited reads extraction
$ ./path2.sh
```
### Dependencies:
The script was developed under Linux Mint 16 "petra" but is compatible with other LINUX debian based distribution. The following dependencies are required by the pipeline. Users should verify that all of these programs are added to its PATH and correspond at least to the indicated version.
* GNU bash, version 4.2.45(1)-release
https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/
* Sickle (v1.210)
https://github.com/najoshi/sickle
* Bowtie2 (v2.1.0)
http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/index.shtml
* Samtools (v0.1.19-96b5f2294a) 
http://samtools.sourceforge.net/
* Bedtools (v2.17.0)
https://github.com/arq5x/bedtools2/release
